newsitem.title: USA: Toys, Baby Superstore up after deal.
newsitem.headline: Toys, Baby Superstore up after deal.

text.p: News that Toys R Us Inc agreed to buy Baby Superstore Inc in a $376 million stock merger got a warm Wall Street greeting, sending both of the stocks higher on Wednesday.
Toys R Us shares rose 1-7/8 to 30-3/4. Baby Superstore shares rose 4-3/8 to 24-1/4 in heavy trading.

Baby Superstore holders would receive 0.8121 of a Toys R Us share for each of their shares, worth roughly $23.45 based on Tuesday's share closing price. As Toys R Us stock climbs, the dollar value for Baby Superstore holders also rises.

"This is a great deal for Toys R Us. It's fairly inexpensive ... and it gives them a front row seat in this strong business concept, the burgeoning baby business," said Kurt Barnard, president of Barnard's retail marketing report.

Baby Superstore's chairman, Jack Tate, who owns a 46.8 percent stake in the company is willing to receive less as part of the deal. He would receive 0.5150 of a Toys R Us share for each of his shares and has already agreed to vote his shares in favor of the merger.
